title: Mass-Density Formula
text: Let p(x) be an integrable function representing the radial density of a disk of radius $$r$$. Then the mass of the disk is given by $$m=\int_{0}^{r} 2\pi p\left(x\right) \,dx$$
speech: Let p(x) be an integrable function representing the radial density of a disk of radius  r . Then the mass of the disk is given by  m, is equal to the integral from 0 to r of 2 pi p of x d x
pacedSpeech: Let p(x) be an integrable function representing the radial density of a disk of radius   r
. Then the mass of the disk is given by   m, is equal to the integral from 0 to r of 2 pi p of x d x

title: Find the integral
text: We can evaluate the integral separately: $$2*pi*\int_{0}^{10} x \,dx$$ and $$2*pi*\int_{0}^{10} cos\left(\pi x\right) \,dx$$
speech: We can evaluate the integral separately:  2 times p i times the integral from 0 to 10 of x d x,  and  2 times p i times the integral from 0 to 10 of cosine of pi x, d x

and   2 times p i times the integral from 0 to 10 of cosine of pi x, d x

title: Evaluate first integral
text: $$2*pi*\int_{0}^{10} x \,dx$$ is $$\frac{2\pi x^2}{2}$$ with the limit from $$x=0$$ to $$x=10$$
speech: 2 times p i times the integral from 0 to 10 of x d x,  is  fraction, 2 pi x squared, over 2,   with the limit from  x is equal to 0  to  x, is equal to 10

is   fraction, 2 pi x squared, over 2,
with the limit from   x is equal to 0

title: Evaluate second integral
text: $$2*pi*\int_{0}^{10} cos\left(\pi x\right) \,dx$$ is $$-\left(\frac{x}{\pi}\right) sin\left(\pi x\right)$$ with the limit from $$x=0$$ to $$x=10+\frac{1}{\pi} \left(-\frac{1}{\pi} cos\left(\pi x\right)\right)$$ with the limit from $$x=0$$ to $$x=10$$
speech: 2 times p i times the integral from 0 to 10 of cosine of pi x, d x  is  negative parentheses x over pi,  sine of pi x  with the limit from  x is equal to 0  to  x, is equal to 10 plus 1 over pi, times parentheses negative 1 over pi cosine of pi x   with the limit from  x is equal to 0  to  x, is equal to 10
